title.narrative: QUALITY NUTRITION SERVICES

description.narrative: By 2022, health facilities are strengthened to equitably provide quality nutrition services., which contributes to Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition (Covid), Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022,boys and girls aged 0-59 months, adolescents and women (especially those living in the most disadvantaged communities) have access to basic services, use packages of multisectoral high-impact, gender-sensitive interventions (health /HIV, nutrition, WASH) and adopt appropriate behaviours.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, health facilities are strengthened to equitably provide quality nutrition services.

description.narrative: In 2019, the treatment capacity of 150 health centres and 109 health posts was strengthened. A total of 497 health workers were trained and now use the new protocol for the care of children. Meanwhile, 11,648 children – girls and boys – were admitted for the treatment of SAM, with a cure rate of over 90%. A network of 800 women's groups supervised by 1,600 leaders whose capacities had been strengthened made it possible to offer integrated nutrition services in support of health centres in the 40 convergence municipalities. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: The communes of convergence have networks of women's groups that carry out activities for preventing stunting
Number of girls and boys who did benefit from 2 doses of Vitamin A
Proportion of health care facilities that offer routine Vitamin A supplementation according to the standard protocol
Number of children aged 6-59 months with SAM who are admitted for treatment
Percentage of districts implementing the minimum package to prevent stunting in children
Proportion of health care facilities with no Plumpy nut stock out
Proportion of health providers trained on the new Integrated Management of Acute Malnutrition protocol
The country has a situational analysis of IYCF practices in order to develop a budgeted plan and increase the practice of exclusive breastfeeding and the improvement of food diversity

actual.value: 2019:In order to develop an IYCF budgeted plan for 2020, an IYCF situational analysis (Exclusive Breastfeeding and food Diversity) and a study on early breastfeeding services are being finalized.
